greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,m) is the number of acyclic edge covers of the complete bipartite graph K_{n,m}.
comment: In other words, the number of spanning forests of the complete bipartite graph K_{n,m} without isolated vertices.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Complete Bipartite Graph
formula: T(n,m) = A072590(n, m) + Sum_{i=1..n-1} Sum_{j=1, m-1} binomial(n-1, i-1) * binomial(m, j) * A072590(i, j) * T(n-i, m-j).
program: T(n, m=n)={my(M=matrix(n, m), N=matrix(n, m, n, m, n^(m-1) * m^(n-1))); for(n=1, n, for(m=1, m, M[n,m] = N[n,m] + sum(i=1, n-1, sum(j=1, m-1, binomial(n-1, i-1)*binomial(m, j)*N[i,j]*M[n-i, m-j])))); M}
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Oct 29 2019
